column4: maybe I cant you the SCSI as the primary drive. Maybe I must reinstall on the SATA and use that as my root filesystem. Could this be correct
there is no mplayer....i need something to add to sources.list
oh well then get the address of your nearest ftp server
and how do i find the nearest ftp server that has mplayer packaged for breezy?
it doesn't show up when i apt-cache search for it
well most universitys here archive all the latest linux software and distros
could you be a little more specific as to HOW i would find such a server?
gpm:try deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy -updates main restricted
and then the same line under that with deb-src
You should set up apt correctly and then it will be easy to get whatever stuff u want
i am trying to set up apt
yes I know, i was just suggesting you put what I posted into sources.list rather than what boxerboy said (directing you to mplayer site)
i already have an archive.ubuntu.org line in sources.list
i don't think ubuntu packages mplayer officially. i need an external source
ok maybe, have you sucessfully downloaded stuff with apt b4
